alert.note: Alert for Mora; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 8:40PM MDT until August 17 at 10:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 840 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated showers producing light to moderate rain over the southern half of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon burn scar. Between 0.1 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact the Gallinas Creek and Gallinas River drainage area including Porvenir Canyon, Arroyo Pecos, Agua Zarca and Vegosa Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Montezuma, Sapello, Storrie Lake State Park, Gascon, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County, Gallinas, Manuelitas and Rociada. This includes the following low water crossings... West Las Vegas High School, Mills Bridge and Valencia Street. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 3. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 13. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 343 and 349. State Road 283 between Mile Markers 1 and 8. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 2 and 8. This includes the following streams and drainages... Into Pecos, Arroyo, Gallinas Creek, Zarca, Agua, Hollinger Creek, Manuelitas Creek, Rocio, Ca√±ada de, Sparks Creek, Sapello River, South Fork Bear Creek, Upper Tecolote Creek, Oso, Rito del, Tecolote Creek, Elk Creek, Pecos, Arroyo / Storrie Project Irrigation Can, San Jose, Rito, Beaver Creek, Cow Creek, Into Manuelitas Creek, Into Zarca, Agua, Bear Creek, Into Gallinas River, Into Storrie Project Irrigation Can, Arroyo la Manga, Bull Creek, Canada del Alto Reunion / Cabo Lucero, Chavez, Rito, Sanguijuela Arroyo, Pecos, Arroyo, Into Tecolote Creek, Colorado, Rito, Gallinas River and Maestas Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak Calf Canyon fire burn area. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
